poem:
Hidden Ties

In the shadows where whispers  
become secrets, photographs  
linger like old ghosts—  
a smile caught mid-lie.  
  
The pages turn themselves, a history  
unveiled with each crease. All eyes  
peer into the folded space,  
where truth flutters  
like a trapped bird—  
yearning for light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Seth Meyers on the Epstein files: ‘The more you try to hide something, the more people want to see what it is’ Late-night hosts continue to sort through Donald Trump’s Jeffrey Epstein files mess as more old photos and videos demonstrate their close relationship. Seth Meyers Seth Meyers took the Late Night stage on Wednesday to relish another especially bad week for Donald Trump. “Even with his established history of unraveling, the last few weeks". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
